content.description: From the top of Posse Whipped follow a flake feature to a crimpy section to the anchors. Great view!
content.protection: 3 additional bolts to those on Posse Whipped. Bolted anchors.

content.description:
Start on the Hueco hold and make some ultra crimpy moves out left and up to a good hold and a double kneebar rest at a ledge... From here there are a few tricky spots but the crimpy start is definately the crux... Continue up the wall on 5.11ish climbing to the anchors...

Its 5.12b for tall folks, harder if short...
content.location: In the middle of the Indy Wall... Look for a chalked up hueco hold to start...

content.description: Thin crimping to a big move at the top.
content.location: Walk left from the main Indy Wall area. This route is the middle of the three slab routes on the far left end of the wall.

content.description: Thin, balancy route. Crux around the 4th bolt and then a tough move protects the anchors
content.location: Walk left from the main Indy wall area. This is the right of the three far left slab routes.
Continue past the anchors on Social Stigma.

content.description: Thin moves throughout. Funky traverse move up high. Lots of fun
content.location: Walk left from main Indy Wall. Furthest left route of three slab routes.

content.description: Climb up the offwidth by bringing some of that wide technique or moving to the right and using face holds then work your way into the chimney placing gear in the dirty crack at the back. Traverse right across the hand ledge at the roof to clip the anchors of Face Up to that Arete or continue out the roof on the left.
content.protection: A few midsize pieces. You can stick clip the first bolt of the neighboring sport climb to protect the first moves.
content.location: From the approach trail follow the cliff left past all the crimpy climbs to a bolted arete. This climbs the crack to the left of the arete off a short ledge.

content.description: Interesting route. Back to back cruxes at the beginning and then pretty chill climbing to the anchors.
content.location: Route to the right of Mentor Powers, on the other side of the tree.

content.description: Start out with some bouldery moves until the wall turns slabby.  Follow small holds to a really nice set of jugs where the wall kicks back a little.  From here, head up left using some crimps to make a reachy move to a great jug (crux).  Clip the shuts to the right.
content.location: In the center of the Indy Wall, between Stretcherous and The Happy Fisherman.

content.description: Route to the right of Annie the Annihilator. Start on crimps and pull through cool crimps and jugs on a mildly overhanging wall to a crux about halfway up. Pumpy.
content.location: Right of Annie the Annihilator, immediately before a Beech Tree growing very close to the wall.

climbs.name: Makin' Bacon
climbs.fa: Jared Hancock, Karla Carandang, and Tim Powers, 2004

content.description: Start on the giant hueco/undercling to make a long, somewhat bouldery move. From here, an enduro-crimp fest awaits. Short, and not all that pumpy unless crimps aren't your thing. One tricky move near the top to (you guessed it) a small crimp. Awesome movement and cool holds. Good technical skills will get you through this one just fine.

climbs.name: The Happy Fisherman
climbs.fa: Tim Powers, Karla Carandang, Jared Hancock, 2004.

content.description: Slabby technical start to overhanging juggy finish

climbs.name: Face Up to That Arete
climbs.fa: Jared Hancock, Karla Carandang, Tim Powers, 2004

content.description: This short route begins as a slab and climbs the left side of the arete to an anchor below the roof.
Thin, crimpy, sustained face climb right of Posse Whipped.

A must climb if you come to Muir Valley. Located at the Indy wall, this route is short but classic. A crimpy start leads to pumpy jug hauling up the slightly inverted face. The moves are just so cool and so fun, but suprisingly pumpy for such a short route.
